author: barnabemonnot
content:
Ferveo: Threshold Decryption for Mempool Privacy in BFT networks https://eprint.iacr.org/2022/898

seems like an alternative solution to shutter network (https://ethresear.ch/t/shutterized-beacon-chain/12249), for tendermint-based chains. also with PoS eth all validators have the same weight, so you have one key per stake increment. but with tendermint you need weighted key shares, as validators have varying amounts of stake. like shutter, they also must charge the full gas fees (up to gas limit) as the block producers can't know how much the transaction will use when executed
